meanings.definition: Put (someone or something) into a situation in which there is a danger of loss, harm, or failure.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the door unlocked jeopardises the safety of our home.
meanings.sent2: Not wearing a seatbelt jeopardises your safety in the car.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to bring an umbrella jeopardises your dryness in the rain.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring warning signs jeopardises your well-being like walking blindfolded.
meanings.sent5: Playing with fire jeopardises your fingers getting burned.

meanings.definition: Expose to loss or injury; imperil.
meanings.sent1: Eating expired food jeopardises your health.
meanings.sent2: Speeding while driving jeopardises your life and others on the road.
meanings.sent3: Skipping breakfast jeopardises your energy levels for the day.
meanings.sent4: Procrastinating jeopardises your success like a ticking time bomb.
meanings.sent5: Swimming in rough waters jeopardises your safety like dancing with danger.
